description: Latin miniatus, past participle of miniare. See minium.

adjectives.description: miniate (comparative more miniate, superlative most miniate)

entries.meaning: Of or relating to the colour of red lead or vermilion; painted with vermilion.

verbs.description: miniate (third-person singular simple present miniates, present participle miniating, simple past and past participle miniated)

entries.meaning: To paint or tinge with red lead or vermilion, or with red letters, as in a manuscript.
examples: At Trinity college in Cambridge is a Psalter in Latin and Saxon, admirably written, and illuminated with letters in gold, silver, miniated, &c.
